name: Hyatt Regency Perth

reviews.text: Having no experience with Perth, I was really in a quandary about where to stay. Hotels there are pricey for what you get. But since I have had some very mediocre experiences with "boutique" hotels in Australia, I decided to stick with a chain, and the Hyatt has had some decent reviews. But for the price, I would say it is a mediocre value.
reviews.title: It grew on me...but the price didn't!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived at the hotel late at night, I was, frankly, appalled. The hotel is stuck with some very terrible 70s-era architecture on the outside, and it is not a welcoming feeling at all. The other thing I didn't like about the entry to the hotel was all the cars parked in front of the property on the parking ramp. It is very cluttered and tight feeling. I stepped into the lobby, and it was quite a bit better, and the check-in person, Harry, was absolutely sweet and friendly. This made things so much better.
reviews.title: Good solid hotel

reviews.text: While our room was not bad, at the price I paid, it was probably the worst room I have ever had. Again, not to say it was terrible. It actually was fairly comfortable. The bed and linens were good and everything appeared clean. But it was not a luxury hotel in any sense, and I was paying luxury prices. Also, it was advertised as having a balcony. I think they should clear up that the balcony is actually a closed-off terrace off the entry hall to the room. The table and chairs on the terrace were sort of strewn around, so no care was taken to make it welcoming in the off season. You could not see this "balcony" from the room, so it was quite different than I expected. But it did have a knock-out view of the Swan River. We did like that, and the view really saved the room in many ways, as we also had a small river view from our bedroom. But all in all, the room was very lightly furnished, and bathroom was just OK. We also had a very noisy generator or something adjacent to the room which ran at random times, even in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Regency Club was better than expected. Certainly better than it would be in a comparable American hotel. The cappuccino machine was good, and there were some decent muffins, cold cuts, etc. At night, they had a similar spread with a wide variety of alcoholic beverages. It was also a very nice crowd in the club at all times. So, I would definitely say the Regency Club is well worth your while at this property. Staff there was friendly, especially in the evening.
reviews.title: Great special, good hotel

reviews.text: This hotel can be very crowded, and obviously people in the community use it. I heard good reports on the restaurants. The location is decent, but it is a bit of a walk to downtown. I didn't mind that, and i guess there is bus service, but the immediate area in nothing special. The parking at the hotel was OK, but could get very crowded on the weekend, leaving one to search quite a bit for spaces in the large parking area.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: First time visit to Perth and was surprised at the limited and below par hotels available. Specifically to the Hyatt:
reviews.title: Marginally OK

reviews.text: Check in:
reviews.title: 5star all the way!
Amazing.........
reviews.text: Very pleasant and quick. Unfortunately, when I asked for a very quiet room (which was also noted on my electronic reservation) they failed to provide.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sleeping Room: Club level, king bed room was extremely small. Assigned a room located on top floor with a service room adjacent which meant very early each morning I got to hear the staff load up their carts for cleaning rooms. Every time someone left that room, they slammed the door. While they were in the room loading their cart, they slammed around jars, bottles, vacuums, etc. Not only is this their supply room but it also holds the service elevators so all night, all day you get to hear the elevator rise and lower.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dining: Club lounge breakfast is limited. Second day I ate in the hotel's breakfast area which is quite nice. I don't drink coffee or tea so was upset that a very big deal was made out of me ordering a diet coke -- and was charged for it because it's not included in the breakfast buffet. Guests can drink gallons of coffee or tea but I'm charged for a diet coke????
reviews.title: Very good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say enough about this hotel, I have stayed here now a couple of times, both times was for two nights.
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Perth

reviews.text: Everything was 1st class. the service and staff were some of the best I've known, and believe me I've stayed in many many 4 and 5 star hotels around the world. Both visits I ate at one of the hotels restarants, and the food and service were both excellent and it was a very busy Saturday night.
reviews.title: Good Accommodation - Terrible Service in Restaurant

reviews.text: Both rooms were a very good size, with a large bathroom, and had soundproofing which worked a treat.I would highly recommend this hotel above any others in Perth, and because I live near Perth and visit often I am in need of a good hotel in which to stay, so glad I found this one, as the others aren't quite as good.
reviews.title: Riverside Retreat

reviews.text: I spent my last two nights of a family holiday in Western Australia in the Hyatt Regency Perth. I arrived early - about 11am which was well before check in time but this was not a problem. The room was ready complete with an extra bed for my daughter. It was a large spacious room and even with the extra bed there was loads of room. As this was a base for exploring the city centre I had plenty of questions for the front desk and concierge. They were helpful and knowledgable. I took my daughter for a sandwich in the cafe restaurant on one of the evenings I was there. It was a simple order of a toasted cheese sandwich. It took over an hour to arrive. I asked several times where it was and each time I was told a few more minutes. The cafe was not busy at the time so I have no idea why it took so long When it finally arrived there was no apology for the time it took. Terrible service in a country where service everywhere we went was fabulous. The hotel is well located close to the city centre with lots to do in the area. The decor throughout is very bland. There are large voids on all levels where flower/plant boxes should be but these are empty. If these were filled it would add greatly to the ambience of the hotel.
reviews.title: Quick stop over before driving down south

reviews.text: This was just a quick overnight trip to Perth en route to the Margaret River, could not have asked for a better hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent early check in

reviews.text: King bedroom, Generous size room with the usual writing desk, comfy chair etc. Very restful colours, and the bed comfortable. Great view of the river. Bathroom needs a bit of an update, shower over bath, but good supply of fluffy towels, and amenities. Room was very comfortable. Nice and quiet. All the staff I came in contact with were great, very professional and helpful. Breakfast is wonderful, great selection and attentive staff ensure you always have a hot beverage. Close to central shopping, easy 20min walk, or catch the free bus right outside...couldn't be easier.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt for 10 nights. Disappointing the room only had 2 singles instead of 2 doubles which I would have expected. Breakfast was $39 which I felt was overpriced. But my main concern was housekeeping. Started off quite well with the room being serviced by morning tea but the last 5 or 6 nights it was not serviced until 4.00pm. I was working from the room a lot and it would have been nice to have got it serviced earlier in the day. I asked but kept getting told sorry. One day I was in the room and the young lady was in and out in just 5 minutes and when I went into the bathroom none of the towels had been replaced, the bin hadn't been emptied and none of the toiletries replaced. I thought Oh well I'll wait for turn down, but this didn't happen. When I rang to complain instead of the manager coming to see me they just sent back the same young lady who I then had to deal with.
reviews.title: Housekeeping let it down

reviews.text: Not bad at all, check-in was easy and no hassles at all. Requested for access of the club lounge room for the 3 nights. The rooms are very spacious and modern. It looks like the hotel had some refurbishments just recently. The beds are comfortable however in room dinning Pizza felt abit cheap in regarding the toppings and quality. Over not a bad hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: One of the better hotels in Perth

reviews.text: Great room, large, well appointed with huge shower (so no climbing into a bath at 8 months pregnant!). Breakfast and dinner were fantastic. Service was good and staff were friendly. I hope I can stay here again soon.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels Perth has to offer

reviews.text: I recently stayed there for three nights. I was there for business. I really enjoyed my stay. The room was excellent and the food was very good indeed. I was very happy with the service all round. The staff were excellent - in the dining room, at the front desk and in the business centre. I would gladly stay there again.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

description: Situated near the banks of the Swan River, on the eastern edge of Perth's central business district and shopping precinct. Hyatt Regency Perth Hotel is convenient to arts, parks, entertainment and convention centres.
